Name: Gin Daisy #2 (Jerry Thomas style)
Ingredients: 15 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: SHAKE first four ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. TOP with a splash of soda from a siphon.
Review: The rich style of genever combines wonderfully with orange liqueur in this balanced classic.
History: The origins of the Daisy are lost in time but the first written reference to it is in an 1866 novel called 'Gay Life in New York, or Fast Men and Grass Widows' by Henry Llewellyn Williams. This recipe is adapted from Jerry Thomas' 1876 'How to Mix Drinks'.
Nutrition: One serving of Gin Daisy #2 (Jerry Thomas style) contains 137 calories
